results.title: London
results.creator_credit: David McKenzie and Associated Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Travel tips”.
How do I get around in a city like London? What type of coat should I pack? What is the best time to see the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace? Where’s an old English pub? Where should I go outside of London? These are just some of the questions travel expert Laura McKenzie answers in this fascinating tour of London. Included are day trips to Windsor Castle, Blenheim Palace, Stratford-upon-Avon, Ragley Hall and Warwick Castle.

results.brief_description: A musical tour of London showing various historical sites and icons to a selection of tunes including “Around the Marble Arch”, “Let’s all go down The Strand”, “Old father Thames”, “London Bridge is falling down” etc.

results.title: Lon Chaney: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
A condensed version of the classic silent film of the Victor Hugo novel which was a masterpiece of film-making. Shows details of Lon Chaney’s elaborate makeup for his role as the hunchback Quasimodo and ends with an epilogue in tribute to the remarkable star. Dubbed “The man of a thousand faces”, Chaney’s portrayal of Quasimodo is not the only outstanding feature of this production. The set which took a year to build, the enormous cast of extras and night photography adds to the epic grandeur of the film which also starred Brandon Hurst, Nigel De Brulier and Patsy Ruth Miller as Esmeralda.

results.title: Log house = Cabane de rondins
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman, ONF | NFB, Michael Rubbo and Andreas Poulsson
results.brief_description: This film is about the building of a traditional log cabin in Quebec. It starts with the tree and finishes with the housewarming. While it is not a realistic housing option for many Canadians, it does provide encouragement for all of us to re-examine the resources around us that we may not be using effectively, if at all. French dialogue only. (Awards: Brussels; New York)

results.title: Log drive
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: In words and music this 1957 film brings to the screen a great seasonal event of the Quebec spruce forest - the log drive. A ballad singer comments musically on this annual spectacle. Water-borne, the vast aggregation of logs moves downstream, spurred by dynamite and sharp-tipped cant hooks, tossed and twirled by the boots of leaping men.

results.title: Locomotion
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Jones Films, British Transport Films and Geoffrey Jones
results.brief_description: Documentary celebrating 100 years of British railway history and the opening of the world’s first steam hauled public railway, the Stockton and Darlington Line. Its first engine became known as “Locomotion”. Uses collections of prints and sketches of people and architectural sights from a variety of museums and archival and picture libraries in the United Kingdom.

results.title: Locking devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Starts by showing diagrammatically the effect of vibration on a nut and bolt to draw attention to the necessity for some way of preventing the nut coming undone. Various devices for this purpose are demonstrated.

results.title: Loch Lomond
results.creator_credit: IFA (Scotland), Films of Scotland and Laurence Henson
results.brief_description: A study of human and wild life throughout the year, in, on, and around Loch Lomond. Gives a picture of the life and work of a Highland community - the wild life conservator, research biologist, shepherd, farmer and publican, all of whom know the Loch in its many moods.

results.title: Localising troubles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An intercarrier sound receiver using the flyback high voltage supply is used as a typical example in explaining how to identify trouble symptoms and localise them in a specific section of the receiver by studying the three indicators present in the receiver itself - raster, picture and sound.

results.title: Local traffic: a suburban dilemma
results.brief_description: Sandringham is a suburb where through traffic is causing problems in local streets. The program follows the process whereby residents press their local council to take action on the problem. A firm of consultants is appointed and we see the following five stages at work: the study, the proposal, the survey, the debate and the outcome.
